alert.note: Alert for Bradley; East Polk; Hamilton; McMinn; Meigs; Northwest Monroe; West Polk (Tennessee) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued November 29 at 4:42PM CST by NWS Knoxville
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Bradley, southwestern Meigs, Polk, southern McMinn, southwestern Monroe and southeastern Hamilton Counties through 630 PM EST... At 541 PM EST, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 10 miles northwest of Cleveland to near Ringgold. Movement was east at 45 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Chattanooga, Cleveland, Benton, Etowah, Charleston, South Cleveland, East Cleveland, Wildwood Lake, Collegedale and Calhoun. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.

area.areaDesc: Bradley; East Polk; Hamilton; McMinn; Meigs; Northwest Monroe; West Polk
